text: at the High Court in London the
Hollywood actor Johnny Depp has denied
that he regularly engaged in destructive
and violent behavior in relation to his
former wife Amber Heard the actor is
suing the publisher of the Sun newspaper
that's news Group Newspapers
and its executive editor dan wooden over
an article published in 2018 which
called him a wife-beater he strongly
denies the allegations but the
publishers say that the description of
him was entirely accurate
our correspondent David salato has this
report Johnny Depp arriving in court
this morning he's brought this case to
try to clear his name of an allegation
that he is a wife-beater
it was those words that were in a
headline in an article in the Sun when
the journalist Dan wooden questioned JK
Rowling supporting the casting of Johnny
Depp in an adaptation of her fantastic
beasts book the allegations of physical
abuse were made by Johnny Depp's former
wife
Amber Heard who also arrived at court
this morning to watch proceedings the
heart of this case is Johnny Depp's
reputation the accusations that he
repeatedly assaulted
Amber Heard that he seriously injured
her and at times left her fearing for
her life the son says there was
overwhelming evidence supporting her
claims all of this Johnny Depp denies
the court was shown this footage
secretly filmed by Amber Heard of an
angry Johnny Depp kicking doors and
drinking he was asked in court would you
agree you were violent he answered there
was violence with some cupboards he said
there was no violence towards Amber
Heard and that it was she who had
punched him in one incident he said she
had partially severed his finger after
throwing a vodka bottle libel cases such
as this are rare these days and payouts
unlikely to compensate for the huge cost
but this is about reputation I don't
think it's going to be about a big
liable payment I think there'll be other
reasons for doing it personal reasons
for doing it and reputational reasons
yeah there's not going to be a huge
pay out I would think you came today
because you crave something new
something different the trigger for the
original article was the decision to
recast him in the fantastic beasts movie
the cases shone a light on the private
life of one of Hollywood's biggest stars
his drinking his drug use and his temper
he admits the relationship was volatile
but denies assaulting Amber Heard
lawyers say she stands by her claims and
disputes his version of events and she
will and the days to come
give her account to a case which is
scheduled to last three weeks debits
Alito BBC News
